objectIdentifier.objectName: Capture d'écran du poème lors de sa collecte

div.p: TRENDING NOW - what genre of person i hate are you?⋆˚꩜｡

div.note: Les deux éléments textuels ci-dessus ont été traités dans l'encodage comme des paragraphes, ce qui nous parait insatisfaisant, le premier contenant une information générique permettant de typer cet objet digital, l'autre étant un titre de section. C'est un point que nous chercherons à améliorer dans d'éventuels développement futurs.
div.p: a minotaur more than justifies the existence of the labyrinth. (cw: mentions of death, dereality, depersonalization, and family. based off of the wizard maze and christopher manson's the maze.)

div.note: L'ordinateur ne garde pas en mémoire les choix de l'utilisateur. Cette fonctionnalité est absente du code. En effet, nous n'avons pas eu accès à la structure logique du test original encodé sur la plateforme Uquiz. Plutôt que de réinventer une structure, les éléments interractifs (cases à cocher et interfaces d'écritures) sont des éléments vides, des espaces d'oubli. Nous reviendrons sur ce point.

div.p: Design your ideal date and I'll tell you your type
Which marauders era girl are you?
what random thing that i've been interested in recently are you?
which spn coded character are you but i psychoanalyze your result
which of the 16 main archetypes are you? (the answers are very personal)
Which Dandy's World Toon Are You? (New characters coming!)
What Stray Kids song are you based on random things
Do you agree with my hear me outs?
What name would Flavor Flav give you?
Which Monster High friend group would you be in?
You rate my OCD Obsessions and I assign you one
which taylor swift album do you remind me of?
what is your role in someone else's story? -:-
Which Monster High Character Are you?
would I smash or pass u?? (hard to get)
What type of water are you??
R u my type (im a girl btw)
what is your aura based on your snl opinions
Build your Wizard's Tower and I will give you a robe
I hand you a gift. Open it and see what you get.

note.p: Un test Uquiz ne constitue pas un objet isolé, mais s'inscrit dans un écosystème d'hyperliens et de contenus similaires. L'expérience de lecture sur cette plateforme est essentiellement une expérience ludique : on ne s'y engage pas pour évaluer ses connaissances, mais pour perdre délibérément son temps.

Cette temporalité spécifique est rendue possible par la structure même de l'interface, qui multiplie les sollicitations par des liens vers d'autres quiz. Le choix éditorial a été de conserver, dans l'encodage et la réédition numérique, la matérialité de ces possibilités de distraction. Ainsi, le lecteur peut expérimenter ce mode de lecture particulier, caractérisé par la dispersion, la navigation aléatoire et l'errance hypertextuelle.

Les titres des quiz, hautement référentiels et souvent constellés de références culturelles ou d'« inside jokes », représentent également des témoins historiques et culturels significatifs. Ils peuvent susciter chez l'utilisateur un sentiment de jeu et de reconnaissance, ou au contraire une étrangeté pour celui qui n'en maîtrise pas les codes.

div.note: Les mentions publicitaires renvoient à un contexte numérique spécifique : celui d'un web marchand où la gratuité des services s'échange contre l'exposition à un flux constant de sollicitations commerciales. Elles documentent ainsi non seulement l'économie sous-jacente de la plateforme Uquiz, mais aussi l'imaginaire d'un internet saturé de publicités. Nous avons choisi de les traduire par une simple mention, une trace, un indice de leur présence dans l'environnement natif du texte.

div.p: TRENDING NOW : which one of my friends do i ship you with

div.note: Les bannières « trending » présentent une fonctionnalité de distractibilité similaire à celle des autres liens, mais s'en distinguent par leur modalité d'apparition dans l'interface originale. Dans la page web source, ces bannières occupent une position dynamique en tête de page, défilant horizontalement dans un espace dédié. Cette disposition les différencie des distractions placées en bas de page, qui relèvent davantage d'une logique de suggestions complémentaires. Le choix éditorial a donc été d'isoler ces bannières dans une catégorie distincte, afin de préserver cette distinction spatiale et fonctionnelle. Toutefois, notre encodage opère une transformation importante : ces bannières perdent leur caractère dynamique pour devenir des éléments statiques. À l'instar des mentions publicitaires précédemment rencontrées, elles constituent des traces, des indices témoignant d'un état matériel antérieur du texte.

div.p: the door swings behind you, and you are here. the dusty room with the sheer curtains and the wine colored carpet. the floor is a mess, covered in items: a wrinkled map, covered in an unknown language; an umbrella with an "I" carved in the handle; a ball of twine, frayed at the end; a silver hand mirror with a hairline crack. which do you pick up?

note.p: Ici s'est posé un problème de modélisation. Ce bouton « NEXT » constitue-t-il une composante intrinsèque du texte poétique, ou relève-t-il exclusivement de la couche d'interface ? C'est en effet moins le terme lexical « NEXT » lui-même qui importe que la fonction qu'il incarne : le geste de progression dans la séquence narrative. L'interface graphique, dans son design spécifique, ne présente pas d'intérêt sémiotique déterminant pour notre corpus ; c'est l'action de basculement entre les pages qui structure l'expérience de lecture.

Ainsi, le choix éditorial adopté a été de ne pas encoder le mot « NEXT » comme élément textuel, mais de modéliser la relation de succession par un lien structurel (rendu dans l'encodage par l'adjonction d'un identififiant xml à chaque question du test, ainsi qu'un lien par l'attribut @next vers l'identifiant de la question suivante). Le bouton est ensuite généré dynamiquement via la transformation XSLT. C'est ainsi l'étape suivante, celui de la transformation du fichier XML à l'aide d'une XSL Stylesheet qui permet de faire apparaitre le texte NEXT, texte dont la nature diffère de celle du corps du poème, qui a une fonction d'interface, de manifestation graphique d'un lien hypertextuel.

div.p: TRENDING NOW - What candle scent are you?
the next room is dark, the lamps burning incredibly low. you see yourself in the mirrors, and your appearance is warped. how do you see yourself?

list.item: i am me. that is all.
i am beautiful. i am a god.
i am grotesque. i am a beast.
i am beautiful. i am a beast.
i am an adventurer. the maze doesn't scare me.

note.p: L'édition de ce texte s'effectue sans accès à l'infrastructure logique sous-jacente, au « chemin décisionnel » qui, dans l'objet source, associe chaque choix utilisateur à une issue (une solution) spécifique. Cette absence soulève une question centrale : comment encoder une expérience de lecture dont la logique interne nous échappe ?

La première option explorée a été de conserver les éléments interactifs originaux : cases à cocher et interfaces d'écriture. Ces composantes sont essentielles à la construction de l'expérience spécifique du test, puisqu'elles sollicitent activement le geste du lecteur et matérialisent l'attente d'une réponse. Toutefois, notre édition ne mémorise pas les choix effectués ; nous avons renoncé à reconstituer une logique décisionnelle qui relèverait de la pure spéculation.

Cette approche préserve une caractéristique fondamentale du parcours labyrinthique : bien que le texte adopte la forme d'un quiz, sa structure semble déjouer toute stratégie herméneutique cohérente. Cette dimension n'est pas accessoire ; elle participe pleinement au projet esthétique de l'œuvre, qui simule l'expérience de la perdition dans un labyrinthe.

La longueur même du texte (quatre-vingt questions) contribue à cette sensation d'interminable, produisant un allongement temporel de la lecture et un délitement progressif de toute tentative de reconstruction du sens. L'encodage vise ainsi à transmettre non seulement le contenu textuel, mais également cette expérience d'errance et de déprise interprétative.

div.p: TRENDING NOW - Which one of my guy friends would be in love with you?

note.p: L'une des caractéristiques distinctives de ce test, que nous avons délibérément préservée dans notre édition, concerne l'absence de tout dispositif qui permettrait un recul ou une vision d'ensemble sur la séquence des questions.

Contrairement à un questionnaire papier traditionnel, qui offrirait un sommaire, une pagination explicite ou la possibilité de feuilleter l'ensemble, cette interface impose une immersion totale. Le lecteur se trouve littéralement « le nez dans les questions », sans possibilité d'anticiper la suite, de revenir en arrière ou d'évaluer la progression globale.
Cette contrainte structurelle n'est pas neutre : elle oriente fondamentalement les modalités de lecture et d'interprétation.

Notre encodage respecte ainsi cette dimension immersive, renonçant à introduire des éléments de navigation globale qui trahiraient l'expérience originelle. Le lecteur de notre édition, comme l'utilisateur du test en ligne, doit avancer pas à pas sans recul sur son parcours.

div.p: this room is beautiful, and empty. the dark blue walls wrap around you, suffocating, comforting. the paintings on the walls are familiar, you know them. who do you know?

list.item: my mother. her tears glow in the fluorescent light.
my victims. their agony is grotesque.
i don't know these people. what are you saying.
the maze itself is watching me. i have to leave this room.

div.p: this room is utterly nonsensical. the writing on the wall shifts between readable and incomprehensible. a myriad of objects adorn the wall, and one of them catches your eye. it points you the right way. what is it?

list.item: the painting - it shows a faceless man, reaching towards the viewer. he is pointing to the door behind you.
the coat on the hook - it was left behind another visitor. the right sleeve is shorter than the left.
the news clipping - you've never heard of the town, the people, the crime. nobody is looking at the camera.
the bouquet of flowers - they're fresh. someone was here before. you listen for footsteps.
the taxidermy bull - its horns have words carved on it: "saints" and "sinners"

div.note: Ce timer n'est pas une fonctionnalité opératoire, il ne s'accompagne pas d'un véritable décompte qui produirait un sentiment d'urgence. Nous avons conservé cette indication comme reliquat de l'interface originelle, à l'instar des mentions publicitaires.

div.p: This question is timed. You must answer within: 2 seconds
how does this make you feel?

list.item: he is royalty. just like me.
he is above all. just like me.
he is terrible. just like me.
he is free. just like me.

div.p: the next room is some kind of basement. the wooden beams shed dust, the paint cloths spill over onto the floor, and dust Motes encircle your head. which way do you go?
as you approach the doorway, someone runs past, glances at you, their eyes widening, then runs faster, disappearing behind the wall. why?

list.item: they're showing me the way out!
they are afraid of what they don't understand
they fear me for who they think i am.
they fear me for who they know me to be.

div.p: the next area is an outdoor pathway, encircling a courtyard. you hear something. what is it?

list.item: my mother is sobbing. is it my birthday?
the hero's sword is dragged against the stone. is my end near?
i can hear the birds. can i stop and listen?
my father's laughter. is this home?
no for real is there something here

div.p: the next entry way is pleasantly cool. the oaken floor is slick with polish, and the still life paintings glisten with ripe fruit. suddenly, an apple pops out from the painting. what do you do?

note.p: Cette séquence de propositions révèle une caractéristique structurelle essentielle du test : l'apparente défaillance ou l'ironisation de toute logique décisionnelle.

La répétition quasi-identique des options, à l'exception d'un unique item ici mis en valeur par sa différence, sape toute possibilité d'établir un système cohérent de correspondances entre choix utilisateur et progression narrative. Cette configuration vide ainsi les choix de l'utilisateur de leur potentiel stratégique. Le lecteur choisit, mais son choix semble déconnecté de toute trajectoire interprétative cohérente.

Cette esthétique de la répétition participe pleinement au projet labyrinthique de l'œuvre, où l'accumulation de décisions apparemment identiques mine la croyance en la possibilité même d'un « sens spécifique » gouvernant la navigation.

div.p: the next room is covered in paintings, realistic, baroque, and romantic. the walls are dark, and the smell is cloying. you look at a painting of a man pointing at the door to the left of you. the door is heavy and oaken, with a golden doorknob. when you look back at the painting, the man is pointing to the right. the a wide archway spills Into another room. which way do you go?
the room is clean and white, with strange, abstract paintings adorning the wall. the lights highlight different pieces in stark contrast. what does the painting make you think of?

list.item: the jilted lover that gave me my gift
the hero that took my life
the mourning father that built my home
the old neighbor that dried my tears
there's a noise behind me. i'm scared to turn around.

div.p: you hear a noise coming from behind you. you turn around to see the door behind you, the knob rattling. something is trying to get in. you walk over to try the door, but it is locked. the rattling stops.

list.item: i'm serious what is following me
they left for their own good

div.p: you delve further into the white room. what are you focusing on?

list.item: that statue. it looms over me.
the locked door. i can't forget it.
i can see the exit sign right there let me out rn

div.p: you walk through a glass vestibule. the sun shines through the glass, warming you. you can see the endless expanse of the outside. freedom is so close and yet so far.

list.item: please say i'll be free soon

div.p: you hear the noise again. what is it?

list.item: let me out of here. i will give anything
let me go before it's too late
they're going to lead me out!
i knew there was something in here with me

div.p: This question is timed. You must answer within: 9 seconds
its right behind you. its presence is right there. what do you do?

list.item: i run as fast as i can
i curl up into a ball

div.p: you find yourself in a new room. you recognize this man clearly, and he fills you with an emotion. what is it?

list.item: pride. i will succeed where he has failed.
love. i can't wait to see him again.
did he just move? i swear he's breathing

div.p: you cross a balcony overlooking a pool. it's beautiful and cool.

list.item: i will stay here for a while
please, i cannot be here for much longer
the water is so beautiful, i could just go for a swim
i want to keep moving. i'm sure that statue was moving.

div.p: the bodies of those who have met the monster in the maze.

list.item: wait are we not going to discuss what just happened
i want to see the monster!
no but actually wtf was that last question

div.p: in the next room you encounter an image of a crown, carved above a door. how does it make you feel?

list.item: at home. my father was a king.
indifferent. nobility has no impact on my life.
saddened. the nobility made me what i am today.
flattered. this door is meant for me.
the jilted lover who knows the secret of the maze
the enraged neighbor who knows she was outsmarted
the person who escaped the maze. i will catch her.
the person who escaped the maze. i will follow her.

div.p: how are you feeling? asks the maze. how do you answer?

list.item: i want out of here, please
i feel you consuming me, my very being
please, i've played along long enough (no you haven't)

div.p: the next room has obviously had recent construction. a figure that looks disturbingly familiar points at the two half-made doors. one is labeled "saints" and one is labeled "sinners".

list.item: this is too weird, let me out
maybe we can catch up with the workmen if we keep moving
maybe we can catch the workmen if we keep moving

div.p: you enter a spacious room with many doors. a large bellhop bell rests in the middle, advertising assistance. you think that you must be getting close, seeing as there's so many doors. you are wrong.

list.item: i ring the bell for assistance. (nothing happens)
i enter one of the doors.
i see someone in one of those doors. they just closed it!
i want out of this place
i am desperately looking for the exit
i don't think i'll ever leave
please, ill do whatever it takes
i can't be stuck here forever
this maze will be my grave
i didn't know we needed to be keeping track
this is definitely a mind game

div.p: you are halfway there. what is the holiest number?
now for something entirely different. do you take a fig?

list.item: i do not touch the figs

div.p: as you walk, the noise begins again. it is slightly distorted. what is the noise?

list.item: directions to get out. i deserve this.
the thing from before - i have to leave
the sobs of my mother. it was never my fault.
i break into a cold sweat. i must get away.

div.p: the walls decompose into grass and hedges, and the sound of birds tells you that you are outside of the maze. you do not know how long you've been here. what can you do?

list.item: i listen to the birds - i may never hear them again

div.p: you pass by a statue. you see yourself. who is it?
you are walking through the hall of mirrors. you catch a glimpse of yourself. what do you see?

list.item: my wet, wild eyes. they're bloodshot and i'm afraid.
my wings. i wish i could use them to get out of this place.
my horns. this place is twisting me.
my ethereal glow. i am the master of the maze.

div.p: the hallways are getting narrower, filling with books and bookshelves. you are getting claustrophobic. one of the books falls to the floor. what passage does it show?

list.item: "...let the Minotaur devour me if he can!"

div.p: you see a door, tucked away behind the overflowing books and scrolls. you reach out to try the door, but it is locked. as you turn to walk away, the door handle rattles back.

list.item: how much longer must i run?
i don't care, the thing is behind me

div.p: the beast has touched you. what does it feel like?

list.item: someone reaching for the hem of my coat
the blade of a hero's sword
the thrashing of a wounded creature
there is no beast, it is the maze itself
i don't know, i'm too busy running
please, the beast will follow me
i attack the walls of the maze. they do not react
i beg and plead and cry. nobody listens.
i check over my shoulder for the beast. it hides, but i know it's there.

div.note: Nouvel exemple de cette estéhtique de la récurrences, qui semble détruire toute logique, qui impose un aléatoire dans le résultat final. On a ici un nouvel exmple de la récurrence des propositions qui mine toute logique décisionnelle, instaurant un aléatoire structurel qui vide les choix de leur sens.

list.item: let me out of the maze

div.p: write something for the next visitor, for the hero, or for the beast.
the next room is covered in a thin layer of dust, the smell of old fabric smothering the room. a phonograph sits in the middle of the room, playing a song that makes you sad. why?

list.item: it reminds me that i cannot survive here forever
who was here before me? what happened?
i am the guardian of the maze

div.p: how long was i here? am i still here?

list.item: rip to you but i'm different
i will tear you apart. if you are still here, you must leave.
i'm sorry. i'm so so sorry.

div.p: time for a quiz! what is the name of the dog?
are you ever getting out of here?

list.item: no. the maze is consuming me
no. i belong here. i was born for the maze.

div.p: are you ever getting out of here?

list.item: no. i belong here. the maze belongs to me.

div.p: you are never getting out of here?

list.item: the maze was born for me.
i was made for the maze.
the maze and i are one and the same.

div.p: are you ever getting out of here?
are yoU ever getting out of here?
you pass by a statue. you see yourself. who is it?

list.item: the animal that lives in the maze.

div.p: your shoulders are rolling forward, atlas. what is weighing you down?

list.item: we never saw where the beast went.
nothing. i'm on top of the world.
i'm being consumed in the maze.
i'm losing myself in the maze.
it's not true. it can't be
i knew i'd make it eventually

div.p: 80 is the number of infinity. it combines two 40's, a holy number. 8 is one more than 7, another holy number. you find the door. are you ready?

list.item: i am the master of the maze
the maze will never let me go
for real just get me out of here

div.p: the room at the center of the maze

you know who you are. you come into your own. lightning crackles under the skin where veins converge and flesh is most tender. fire blooms behind your eyes. you know who you are, you are powerful. you are the master of the maze. and now i can die in peace.
div.note: Cette présentation temporaires des solutions n'est pas satifaisante. Une piste envisageable serait de remplacer le bouton de navigation standard par un mécanisme aléatoire qui afficherait l'une des cinq pages-solutions de manière non prédictible. Cette approche préserverait l'esthétique du test original, où l'issue finale semble déconnectée des choix effectués.

div.p: you stumble out of the rooms, the ancient smell clinging to your lips, your cheeks, your skin. you blink once, twice, then look behind you. you do not recognize this place. you have no memories of this place. you reach for the door handle to walk inside.

div.note: Les pages solutions suivantes n'ont pas encore été éditées.
